==Murder Trial==

The former governor of [[Idaho]] had clashed with the WFM in previous strikes, and after the 64-page confession of suspected bomber [[Harry Orchard]], famed [[Pinkerton National Detective Agency|Pinkerton]] detective [[James McParland]] was sent to arrest WFM leaders Haywood, [[Charles Moyer]], and [[George Pettibone]].{{ref|linder5}} On [[February 17]], 1906, McParland secretly arrested Haywood, Moyer, and Pettibone in [[Denver, Colorado]]. In the morning, they were extradited to Idaho for trial.

In the morning, they were extradited to Idaho for trial.
â
Haywood's trial began on [[May 9]], 1907, with famed Chicago defense attorney [[Clarence Darrow]] defending him. Despite the testimony of Orchard (who confessed to assassinating Steunenberg under the orders of the WFM), the prosecution was unable to produce sufficient evidence to convict Haywood.{{ref|linder6}} Haywood and Pettibone were acquitted, and the charges against Moyer were dropped.
